    • Constructor Detail

      • Contract

        public Contract(byte[] sealed,
                @NonNull TransactionPack pack)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Extract contract from v2 or v3 sealed form, getting revokein and new items from the transaction pack supplied. If the transaction pack fails to resove a link, no error will be reported - not sure it's a good idea. If need, the exception could be generated with the transaction pack.

        It is recommended to call Approvable.check() after construction to see the errors.

        Parameters:
        sealed - binary sealed contract.
        pack - the transaction pack to resolve dependeincise agains.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on the various format errors

      • Contract

        public Contract(byte[] data)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • Contract

        public Contract(byte[] sealed,
                net.sergeych.tools.Binder data,
                TransactionPack pack)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Extract old, deprecated v2 self-contained binary partially unpacked by the TransactionPack, and fill the transaction pack with its contents. This contsructor also fills transaction pack instance with the new and revoking items included in its body in v2.
        Parameters:
        sealed - binary sealed contract
        data - unpacked sealed data (it is ready by the time of calling it)
        pack - is TransactionPack for contract was sent with
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on the various format errors

      • Contract

        public Contract()

      • Contract

        public Contract(com.icodici.crypto.PrivateKey key)
        Create a default empty new contract using a provided key as issuer and owner and sealer. Default expiration is set to 5 years.

        This constructor adds key as sealing signature so it is ready to seal() just after construction, thought it is necessary to put real data to it first. It is allowed to change owner, expiration and data fields after creation (but before sealing).

        Parameters:
        key - is PrivateKey for creating roles "issuer", "owner", "creator" and sign contract

      • getRevokingItems

        public java.util.Set<Approvable> getRevokingItems()
        Description copied from interface: Approvable
        List of items that will be revoked on positive consensus. These items will be exclusively locked until the transaction is done. On success (positive consensus) these items will be revoked!
        Specified by:
        getRevokingItems in interface Approvable
        Returns:
        list of items revoked by this transaction.

      • getNewItems

        public java.util.Set<Approvable> getNewItems()
        Description copied from interface: Approvable
        get items created by this transaction. Note, that if the Approvable items does not add self to this list, it will not receive approved state on the positive consensus. Thus, the transactional Apptovable instance could create self, or create other instances on success.
        Specified by:
        getNewItems in interface Approvable
        Returns:
        list of items to approve.

      • getRootId

        protected HashId getRootId()
        Get the root id with the proper logic: for the root contract, it returns its getId(), for the child contracts - the origin id (state.origin field value). Note that all contract states in the chain share same origin - it is an id of the root contract, whose id is always null.
        Returns:
        id of the root contract.

      • addRevokingItems

        public void addRevokingItems(Contract... toRevoke)
        Add one or more contracts to revoke. The contracts must be approved loaded from a binary. Do not call seal() on them as resealing discards network approval by changing the id!
        Parameters:
        toRevoke - is comma-separated contract to revoke

      • addSignatureToSeal

        public void addSignatureToSeal(java.util.Set<com.icodici.crypto.PrivateKey> privateKeys)
        Add signature to sealed (before) contract. Do not deserializing or changing contract bytes, but will change sealed and hashId. Useful if you got contracts from third-party (another computer) and need to sign it. F.e. contracts that shoul be sign with two persons.
        Parameters:
        privateKeys - - key to sign contract will with

      • extractTheContract

        public byte[] extractTheContract()

      • getLastSealedBinary

        public byte[] getLastSealedBinary()
        Get the last knwon packed representation pf the contract. Should be called if the contract was contructed from a packed binary (Contract(byte[]) or was explicitly sealed seal().

        Caution. This method could return out of date binary, if the contract was changed after the seal() call. Before we will add track of changes, use it only if you are sure that seal() was called and contract was not changed since then.

        Returns:
        last result of seal() call, or the binary from which was constructed.

      • createRevision

        public Contract createRevision()

      • createRevision

        public Contract createRevision(Contract.Transactional transactional)
        Create new revision to be changed, signed sealed and then ready to approve. Created "revision" contract is a copy of this contract, with all fields and references correctly set. After this call one need to change mutable fields, add signing keys, seal it and then apss to Universa network for approval.
        Parameters:
        transactional - is Contract.Transactional section to create new revision with
        Returns:
        new revision of this contract, identical to this one, to be modified.

      • split

        public Contract[] split(int count)
        Split one or more siblings from this revision. This must be a new revision (use createRevision(PrivateKey...) first. We recommend setting up signing keys before calling split, otherwise caller must explicitly set signing keys on each contract.

        It the new revision is already split, it can't be split again.

        It is important to understand that this revision become a contract that has to be registered with Universa service, which will automatically register all requested siblings in a transaction. Do not register siblings themselves: registering this contract will do all the work.

        Parameters:
        count - number of siblings to split
        Returns:
        array of just created siblings, to modify their state only.

      • splitValue

        public Contract splitValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                           Decimal valueToExtract)
        Split this contract extracting specified value from a named field. The contract must have suitable SplitJoinPermission and be signed with proper keys to pass checks.

        Important. This contract must be a new revision: call createRevision(PrivateKey...) first.

        Parameters:
        fieldName - field to extract from
        valueToExtract - how much to extract
        Returns:
        new sibling contract with the extracted value.

      • getSiblings

        public java.util.Set<Contract> getSiblings()
        If the contract is creating siblings, e.g. contracts with the same origin and parent but different branch ids, this method will return them all. Note that siblings do not include this contract.
        Returns:
        list of siblings to be created together with this contract.

      • addNewItems

        public void addNewItems(Contract... newContracts)
        Add one or more siblings to the contract. Note that those must be sealed before calling seal() or getPackedTransaction(). Do not reseal as it changes the id!
        Parameters:
        newContracts - is comma-separated contracts

      • getPackedTransaction

        public byte[] getPackedTransaction()
        Pack the contract to the most modern .unicon format, same as TransactionPack.pack(). Uses bounded TransactionPack instance to save together the contract, revoking and new items (if any). This is a binary format using to submit for approval. Use fromPackedTransaction(byte[]) to read this format.
        Returns:
        packed binary form.

      • fromPackedTransaction

        public static Contract fromPackedTransaction(@NonNull byte[] packedItem)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Main .unicon read routine. Load any .unicon version and construct a linked Contract with counterparts (new and revoking items if present) and corresponding TransactionPack instance to pack it to store or send to approval.

        The supported file variants are:

        - v2 legacy unicon. Is loaded with packed counterparts if any. Only for compatibility, avoid using it.

        - v3 compacted unicon. Is loaded without counterparts, should be added later if need with addNewItems(Contract...) and addRevokingItems(Contract...). This is a good way to keep the long contract chain.

        - packed TransactionPack. This is a preferred way to keep current contract state.

        To pack and write corresponding .unicon file use getPackedTransaction().

        Parameters:
        packedItem - some packed from of the universa contract
        Returns:
        unpacked Contract
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the packedItem is broken

      • setTransactionPack

        public void setTransactionPack(TransactionPack transactionPack)

      • getTransactionPack

        public TransactionPack getTransactionPack()

      • createRevocation

        public Contract createRevocation(com.icodici.crypto.PrivateKey... keys)
        Create revocation contract. To revoke the contract it is necessary that it has "revoke" permission, and one need the keys to be able to play the role assigned to it.

        So, to revoke some contract:

        - call createRevocation(PrivateKey...) with key or keys that can play the role for "revoke" permission

        - register it in the Universa network, see Client.register(byte[], long). Upon the successful registration the source contract will be revoked. Use transaction contract's getPackedTransaction() to obtain a binary to submit to the client.

        Parameters:
        keys - one or more keys that together can play the role assigned to the revoke permission.
        Returns:
        ready sealed contract that revokes this contract on registration

      • getRevoking

        public java.util.List<Contract> getRevoking()

                     throws Quantiser.QuantiserException

        Returns:
        true if the set of keys is enough revoke this contract.
        Throws:
        Quantiser.QuantiserException - if processing cost limit is got
